ratings.comment: After a week or two, about half the class was attending lecture. Class should've been relatively easy, with a better teacher.

Bates' method of teaching is to tell how to interpret various stats concepts while having the computer do all the calculations.  I do agree with the philosophy but the class is poorly executed.  Bates doesn't teach from the book at all, and lectures are exceedingly boring.  Attending discussion is essential.  Tests are OK if you make note sheet

STAT 224 was so easy. I don't understand how the average last semester was 69% on the final! I beat that by over 20% and got myself an A. I didn't study anything. I don't understand how any engineer (since we're all pretty smart here) can do badly in statistics. I mean all you have to do is think about it. Just like solving engineering problems!

As mentioned, the lectures are very dry and, quite frankly, pretty boring. Most of the homework is easy, but nothing like what you'll encounter on midterms. Textbook was useful for the first third or so of the semester, then it got way too math-y. Bates is more concerned with interpretation of results rather than the actual calculation.

Class is computer program based. He concentrates on interpretation of data instead of calculation of data. Class if primarily self-taught. Lectures are useless and a hard to understand TA made attendance a joke. Scantron tests and Learn@UW submitted homework make this a light load as long as you prepare for the tests by making allowed cheat sheets

the worlds most boring and not useful powerpoint slides.  entire class consisted of learning programming rather than actual statistics.... thank you for ruining my gpa and glazing my eyes over everyday... i will never have those moments back..
just don't take this course, you'll be bored. I felt confused all the time, lecture is boring and worthless to go. you should choose someone else for stat224

If u like boring profs go for him. his lectures are just meaningless and i only went like only 6 times the whole semester. The TAs cant even speak english.  homework is hard and exmas are even harder even though it is open book. SIMPLY, DONT TAKE HIS CLASS OR U WILL GO TO HELL

He is the most boring professor i have had at UW-Madison, his lectures are so boring and hard to follow, you are better off buying a second statistics book other than the one he recommends(statistics and computing with R by peter daalgard) and reading it rather than going to lectures.

I liked him.  He didn't make you learn the rough calculations and was very for using computer programs which makes things easier.  He made outlines of exactly what you should study before exams too... good guy, helpful in office hours too.

He is EXCEEDINGLY boring in class. You really are much better off doing homework or something else during lecture! Besides that he is quite helpful outside of class. Warning, most of the TAs barely speak English! Also make sure you read the book real well during the first third of the class. Prof Bates did not teach probability very well.

Lectures are exceedingly boring, discussions are crucial to passing. Not very prepared. Wasted 10 minutes of class to get projector to work. I learned nothing from the lectures and had to drop the course after the first exam.

His lectures are extremely boring and not very helpful.  Discussions are essential to succeeding in the class. The homework is difficult but is basically the same material as is on the exam.  Exams are open book and open notes, which is nice, but doesnt make the tests that easy.
very friendly guy.  has open book, open note tests.  homework is fairly difficult but it basically represents the possibilities for exams
Good friendly prof. Fairly fair in grading and fairly good at teacher... kinda one of those solid middle-ground teachers you're recomend to a friend.
